2. Acetylcholine: This is a neurotransmitter that plays a role in the regulation of sweat glands. In the context of the paragraph, it is mentioned that glycopyrrolate blocks the action of acetylcholine on sweat glands, which helps to reduce sweating.
3. Sweat glands: These are specialized glands in the skin that produce sweat (also known as perspiration) to help regulate body temperature. In the context of the paragraph, the treatment is targeting excessive sweating (hyperhidrosis) in the gustatory system, which is responsible for detecting and processing taste stimuli.
